conclusion: To find the electromotive force (EMF) and internal resistance of the power supply, use the information given in the graph and the circuit.
Point A corresponds to the maximum terminal voltage (4V) and minimum current (0A).
Point B corresponds to the minimum terminal voltage (1V) and maximum current (0.8A).
The EMF is the maximum terminal voltage when no current is flowing, which is at point A. Therefore, E = 4V.
Use the relationship between terminal voltage (U), EMF (E), current (I), and internal resistance (r): U = E - Ir.
At point B, U = 1V and I = 0.8A. Substitute the values: 1 = 4 - 0.8r.
The electromotive force (EMF) of the power supply is 4V.
The internal resistance of the power supply is 3.75Ω.
